lines.text: Pseudolus, people do not go around freeing slaves every day.
Be the first. Start a fashion.
That's the brute who raped my country, Thrace!
He raped Thrace?
And then he came and did it again! And then again!
He raped Thrace thrice?

[He's dressed in women's clothing]
My father will turn over his grave if he saw me like this.
Your father is alive.
Well... this will kill him.
Is it contagious?
Have you ever seen a plague that wasn't?
Arrange food, drink, entertainment, and a sit-down orgy for fourteen.
What is she like?
A face so fair, a heart so pure - Sir, if you had been born a woman, you would have been she!
As magnificent as that?
You, slave, will be torn apart by horses, to the plaudits of the troops and the amusement of the children.
[Examining a wine bottle]
Was 1 a good year?
Wait!
Yes?
A brilliant idea!
Yes!
That's what we need, a brilliant idea.

[disguised as a soothsayer and chanting loud gibberish]
I say! You are in need of a soothsayer.
How did you know?
I'd be a fine soothsayer if I didn't.
I live to grovel.
never fall in love during a total eclipse.
Oh, her bridal bower becomes a burial bier of bitter bereavement!
Very good! Can you say "Titus the tailor told ten tall tales to Titania the titmouse"?
For us there will never be happiness.
We must learn to be happy without it.
Don't you think it's time we started trusting each other?
One of us isn't ready yet.

[Speaking of the girl Hero says he loves]
A common courtesan in the house of Lycus?
Is that disgraceful?
There's no way to make it sound like an achievement!
If I've told you once, I've told you a hundred times; do not fan the girls when they're wet! But you'll never learn, you'll be a eunuch all your life.
That breeder woman, has she been thrown a mate yet?
Alas, she refuses just any slave. She demands to choose.
Choose? She'll breed and like it, like everyone. Well, almost everyone.
Rather than let you down, I would die.
That is what I had in mind.
An honest virgin! What a terrible combination!
I shall return in a nonce. At most, two nonces.
Hysterium, this is Philia.
Never mind who she is! Who IS she?
We'll need a body. Anybody's body.
Can you get one from Gusto the Body Snatcher?
He owes me a favor! But he died yesterday.
Uh - what about HIS body?
Somebody snatched it. Uh, let's see... who do we know that's dead?
[He covers his eyes with his hand]

[sadly]
I wish *I* was.
[Pseudolus uncovers his eyes, turns and grins madly at him as if to say, "Aha! That's it!"]
Forgive me for ever having mistrusted you, my darling. But you HAVE been a little distant these past 29 years.
It's against Roman law to take one's life. Penalty's death.
You must never know what goes on in that house.
But I do know.
You do? Isn't it amazing.

[shouting]
Stand aside everyone!
[pause]
I take large steps.
Don't you know? When they start to smile, the end is near. I hear it's lovely on Crete. Everyone lying there... smiling.
I'll kill him! I'll kill him!
Who?
The lyingest, cheatingest, sloppiest slave in all Rome!
Oh, Pseudolus.
She was sold just this morning.
Sold! Then receive, oh bosom, thy fatal blade!
[tries to stab himself and misses]

[takes the blade]
Behave yourself!

[resuming]
He'll pick her up within the hour.
Then receive, oh bosom, thy fatal blade!
[takes another knife out, tries to stab himself, and misses yet again]
Put your bosom away!

[about to leave his fiance's funeral]
But first, a farewell kiss.
Of course!
[kisses him]
Not you!

[seeing his master, who has been seized and kissed by Philia]
Sir! You're back!
She almost broke it!
This I swear by the great Necrophytes, god of pimps, panderers and go-betweens.
[Exits scene, returns]
A new god, but a very hard worker.
[Fertilla, an obese slave, grabs Pseudolus]
My man has come for me!
Good. Where is he?

[talking to the audience about the mare's sweat he needed for his potion]
Would you believe it? There was a mare sweating not two streets away!
These tired old eyes fill with tears at the sight of the little they see...
Gone to see a nose-grinder, indeed. He's cavorting with those courtesans.
But Mother, what can I do?
Return to Rome immediately, before he can do what no doubt he's already done. Go!
[whips Dominia]
A common flesh-peddler in the house next to ours, disgusting!
Disgraceful, all that revolting flesh. Just next door...
My daughter, a eunuch?

[referring to Hero's being alone with Philia]
What can happen in an hour or two?
At his age, the mind boggles!
I cannot afford to offend the gods.
Who can?
Son, if you're only as happy as your mother and I have been... my heart bleeds for you.

[to the stammering Hysterium]
Calm yourself down! I'll tell you when it's time to panic!

[notices the tampered hourglass]
I smell mischief here!

[suddenly filled with dread]
It's time.
How dare you call me a eunuch?
You know it isn't true and I know it isn't true. So what do we care what they think?
Now, back to Rome for a quick wedding - and some slow executions!
Pseudolus...
I'm Lycus!
But, Pseudolus...
I'm Lycus!
But, Pseudolus - !
I'm Lycus, and I still know where you keep that erotic pottery!
Well, Lycus - all right, Lycus! He's Lycus!

[He sees Philia kissing Senex but thinks its's Hero; to the audience]
He gets to look more and more like his father every day.
